blocks.text: These five parts are written in the five sectors of a circle in the order in which they occur in a triangle: this is in Fig. 135, commencing from the side a and making the circlet of the triangle in the direction indicated; the parts in turn are: $A$ for which is written $90^	ext{A}$ (for vertex $A$). These parts are set out as in Fig. 136.
One of the middle part = product of contact of opposite parts.
The terms middle, adjacent and opposite have reference to the triangle as shown in Fig. 136.
In the middle part, the adjacent parts are those in immediate contact with b, viz., a and A (equation (1)).

blocks.description: This equation expresses the relationship between the sides and angle in a triangle.

blocks.text: Again for the adjacent part to A, the adjacent parts are b and B.

blocks.description: This equation shows the relationship for the parts adjacent to angle B.

blocks.text: This gives us something comparable, but these two equations only lend themselves well to logarithmic computation.
The Ambiguous Case in the Solution of Spherical Triangles.
In the case of a triangle of a triangle, if two sides are known and the angle opposite the shorter of these is given, there is the possibility of two different triangles.
